column1: 1015|a quarter past ten|Domino two had me standing sentinel in Mr. Meek’s room watching through the crack in the door. Due to his advanced state of decay
column2: our loyal boiler room mascot wasn’t in on the great escape
column3: but his room was opposite mine
column4: and he understood “Shush!” At a quarter past ten Ernie went to Reception to announce my death to Nurse Noakes.

column1: 1015|quarter past ten|When she finally struggled awake—headachey
column3: feeling hungover—the other half of the bed was empty. Bob had turned his clock back around
column4: and she saw it was quarter past ten. It was the latest she’d slept in years
column5: but of course she hadn’t dropped off until first light
column6: and such sleep as she’d gotten was populated with horrors.

column2: a minute or two later Patrick Redfern came down and registered surprise
column4: etc. Christine's task was easy enough. Keeping her own watch concealed she asked Linda at twenty-five past eleven what time it was. Linda looked at her watch and replied that it was a quarter to twelve.
